comments:
When I try to generate an HTML report from profiling data, I get the error message:
GENERATE_ERROR_For input string: "0,009094"

I also get an error message in .metadata/.log (see below).

I guess that the problem is that Eclipse uses a locale-sensitive method to convert a floating-point number to a String (probably java.text.NumberFormat), and then try to parse it back using a non-locale-sensitive method (java.lang.Double#parseDouble). In my locale (Swedish), the decimal "point" is a comma.

The same problems appears while trying to create a report in CSV and XML format. So, currently it seems to be impossible to create a report for the whole profiling and monitoring session.
I suppose the priority should be higher and it should be assigned for closest release
Navid, can you take a look at this one, please?

Have either one of you guys reproduced this on Windows?
And can you let me know the JDK you were using?
I've got this with windows Xp (en) and JDK 1.4.2_08

I'm unable to reproduce this defect with the 4.3 driver.  I tried this on both Windows and Linux under different locales and couldn't reproduce it.  I generated the report for different views and they all worked fine.  Can you try and reproduce this on the TPTP-4.3.0-200609290100 driver, which can be downloaded here: http://www.eclipse.org/tptp/home/downloads/drops/TPTP-4.3.0-200609290100.html

Please re-open the defect if you were able to reproduce it.  Also note down which profiling options you had enabled and which view you generated the report for.
